id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-45" value="<font style="color: rgb(215, 155, 0);">hypertable</font>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;fontSize=16;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-47"> <mxGeometry x="115" y="70" width="135" height="20" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-50" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><font>iot</font></h1>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="80" y="60" width="180" height="120" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-51" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;">PostgreSQL Cluster</h1><p>Consist in two databases, one for the project itself called `iot` and other database for monitoring the postgres cluster statistics called `monitoring`. The former uses autoexplain, timescaledb and postgis extensions, the latter uses pg_stat_statements, pg_stat_kcache along with timescaleDB to real-time monitoring of these stats.</p><p>Different from SQLserver, Postgres uses the ROLE terminology. In this cluster these are the roles playing:</p><p>- iot: superuser-like user - for security reasons, avoids having around a postgres user.</p><p>- iot_app: user with permissions to operate over iot database in the whole CRUD spectrum.</p><p>- iot_readonly: readonly over iot database.</p><p>- iot_monitoring: user with permissions to operate over monitoring database (and thus with stats extensions)</p><div><br></div>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;spacing=2;verticalAlign=top;horizontal=1;fontSize=12;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="80" y="-220" width="1130" height="250" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-53" value="" style="rounded=1;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;fillColor=none;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="940" y="40" width="870" height="590" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-54" value="sensor" style="shape=table;startSize=30;container=1;collapsible=1;childLayout=tableLayout;fixedRows=1;rowLines=0;fontStyle=1;align=center;resizeLast=1;rounded=1;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="90" y="260" width="250" height="130" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-55" value="" style="shape=partialRectangle;collapsible=0;dropTarget=0;pointerEvents=0;fillColor=none;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;top=0;left=0;right=0;bottom=1;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-54"> <mxGeometry y="30" width="250" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-56" value="PK" style="shape=partialRectangle;overflow=hidden;connectable=0;fillColor=none;top=0;left=0;bottom=0;right=0;fontStyle=1;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-55"> <mxGeometry width="30" height="30" as="geometry"> <mxRectangle width="30" height="30" as="alternateBounds" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-57" value="sensor_id int NOT NULL " style="shape=partialRectangle;overflow=hidden;connectable=0;fillColor=none;top=0;left=0;bottom=0;right=0;align=left;spacingLeft=6;fontStyle=5;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-55"> <mxGeometry x="30" width="220" height="30" as="geometry"> <mxRectangle width="220" height="30" as="alternateBounds" /> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell style="shape=partialRectangle;collapsible=0;dropTarget=0;pointerEvents=0;fillColor=none;points=[[0,0.5],[1,0.5]];portConstraint=eastwest;top=0;left=0;right=0;bottom=0;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-54"> <mxGeometry y="60" width="250" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-59" value="" id="5Wi3_fAo-qg5hoAqXleL-64" value="<h1 style="margin-top: 0px;"><font>monitoring</font></h1>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontFamily=Lucida Console;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="990" y="60" width="180" height="120" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

ellipse.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(255, 255, 255), rgb(18, 18, 18)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

path.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 133px; height: 1px; padding-top: 345px; margin-left: 469px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: "Lucida Console"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

path.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 133px; height: 1px; padding-top: 520px; margin-left: 526px;

div.p: Consist in two databases, one for the project itself called `iot` and other database for monitoring the postgres cluster statistics called `monitoring`. The former uses autoexplain, timescaledb and postgis extensions, the latter uses pg_stat_statements, pg_stat_kcache along with timescaleDB to real-time monitoring of these stats.
Different from SQLserver, Postgres uses the ROLE terminology. In this cluster these are the roles playing:
- iot: superuser-like user - for security reasons, avoids having around a postgres user.
- iot_app: user with permissions to operate over iot database in the whole CRUD spectrum.
- iot_monitoring: user with permissions to operate over monitoring database (and thus with stats extensions)

path.style: fill: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));
